Check JavaScript files
ES version compatibility

Ensure your JavaScript files match the ECMAScript version you need. ES Check helps prevent incompatible code from breaking production. 

npx es-check es5 './dist/**/*.js'
âœ“ Checking 24 files...
âœ“ ES Check passed! All files are ES5 compatible.
npm i es-check --save-dev

Lightning Fast

Quickly scan thousands of files to ensure ES compatibility without slowing down your build process.

Version Specific

Support for all ECMAScript versions from ES3 to ES14/ES2023, ensuring comprehensive coverage.

CI/CD Ready

Seamlessly integrate with your build pipeline to catch compatibility issues before production.

Flexible Configuration

Use CLI arguments or configuration files to customize ES Check for your specific needs.

Browserslist Support

Automatically determine ES version based on your target browsers using browserslist integration.

Detailed Error Reports

Get precise error locations and descriptions to quickly fix compatibility issues.

Advanced Authentication for Modern Security

In today's digital landscape, ensuring the security of your website is paramount. Our Access Shield offers state-of-the-art solutions to safeguard your platform, providing robust user authentication, session management, and role-based access control. 

 
    // Initialize the authentication instance
    const auth = new Auth();
    
    // Register a new user
    auth.register('user1', 'password123');
    
    // Log in an existing user
    auth.login('user1', 'password123');
    
    // Check if user is authenticated
    if (auth.isAuthenticated) {
      // User is authenticated, proceed with accessing secure resources
      console.log("User is authenticated. Proceed with accessing secure resources.")
    } else {
      // User is not authenticated, redirect to login page
      console.log("User is not authenticated. Redirecting to login page.")
    }
    // Simulate accessing secure resources
    if (auth.isAuthenticated) {
      console.log("Accessing secure resources...")
    }

Free and open-source built by the community

ES Check is maintained by a dedicated community of developers who care about JavaScript compatibility. Join us in making the web more accessible by ensuring code works across all target environments.
